channel.title: Help me, please
channel.description: hey guys, ive got a server that i want to put online, ive tryed all the tut's but none worked for me.. maybe could someone do it fo rme on teamveiwer?... ive uploaded the files to a website and downloaded on another computer, and i had it logged in on this computer, and when i logged on my other computer i couldnt see my guy... so could anyone help me get it so some people could play it?..

item.title: Help me, please
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

First, it all depends on the methods you are hosting your server: Hamachi, VPS, Home Computer, Etc. - All of those but Hamachi require you to portforward, which basically allows your router/modem to accept incoming/outgoing packets that other routers/modems send to each other. This is a MUST, and you can find MANY tutorials for portforwarding.

Second, you have to make sure you have properly changed your client’s IP and compiled. This is the 2nd most important thing because without a special client no one can connect to your server.

Also, if you want the best help it is always good that you state the problem you are having piece by piece, because it is really hard to interpret whether you need help getting your client OR server up.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me, please
item.dc:creator: @adamgulka adamgulka
item.description:
@adamgulka wrote:

[quote=“Just Lurkin, post:2, topic:434398”]If you mean webclient:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

If you mean letting others play:
I got a simple way lol…
Hamachi, Setup a network, use that ip for your server (change under client.java and/or server/.java *Other IP is probably 127.0.0.1), then run it using the .bat file.
For them to join they need Hamachi, join your created network, run the client, then log in =) (MUST BE YOUR EXACT CLIENT WITH THE EDITED IP).[/quote]
do you think you could make a pictured tut? i really wanna get it online.

Read full topic
